struct timeval tp

Detailed Description

This is a schduling implementation of the island model. Each islend holds sub-set of the population, in which it applyes a GA. This class has a migration operation to enable for mixing of populations/solution

Author:
S. Koulouzis, T. Wood <skoulouz@science.uva.nl>

Member Function Documentation

void Island::setTaskMiRatings ( vector< double >  miRatings  ) 

This method initializes the population in this island. In the parallel version the population is a sub-set of the global population (a //sub-set of solutions to evaluate). The batchSize sets the size of an individual schedule, that is used in initializing the population, and //running the GA, while the mipsRatings and miRequirements are ther to be used by the GA

Parameters:
int 
int 
ResourceList 
vector<double> set the mpis rating of resources (a vector of doubles) for population initialization, and for the // fitness function in the GA
mipsRatings returns the mpis rating of resources seen by this island
Returns:
vector<double> set the mi rating of tasks (a vector of doubles) for population initialization, and for the fitness function in the GA
Parameters:
mipsRatings

vector< Schedule > Island::migrate ( vector< Schedule >  aPopulation  ) 

After a sertant amount of iterations, the island is migrating some of its population to its neighbor. For MPI this sould be an array for esyer communication.

Parameters:
vector<Schedule> 
Returns:
vector<Schedule>

Schedule Island::runGA ( ResourceList  resourceList,
vector< double >  miRequirements 
)

An MPI recive operation for reciving population from neighbor islands (acoarding to the MPI topology)

Returns:
vector<Schedule> This method starts running a genetic algorithm, based on the population created by the initialize method.After the GA is done it will return a "good" population, optimized by execution time, of size n. Make sure that the initialize method is called before calling this method.
Parameters:
int 
Returns:
vector<Schedule>

end of init

end stopping cond stuff

void Island::taskMi2fastest ( int  option  )  [private]

Allocate tasks to resources depending on task requirements Tasks are either assigned to task by shortest task to fastest resource or if 'option' is set to '1' longest taskto fastest resource...

Parameters:
int 
Allocate tasks to resources depending on task requirements

Tasks are either assigned to task by shortest task to fastest resource or if 'option' is set to '1' longest taskto fastest resource...
